cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 110 miles ENE of West Palm Beach, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Slowly beginning to move northwest, then turning north on Wednesday and north-northeast on Thursday while paralleling the southeast U.S. coastline and passing very near the Georgia and South Carolina coasts
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: coastal vicinity of the Georgia/South Carolina border (near the Savannah River mouth)

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Ponte Vedra Beach FL to South Santee River SC
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast Atlantic coast from east-central Florida through Georgia and South Carolina
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are likely (55% chance) with a 15% chance of 50-kt winds and a low (3%) chance of hurricane-force gusts as the center passes just offshore Wednesday night–Thursday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Life-threatening surge of 4–7 ft above ground possible along the Georgia coast, including the Savannah River entrance, beginning late Wednesday and peaking Thursday with large battering waves.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–6 inches with isolated amounts up to 9 inches, capable of producing flash flooding in and around Savannah.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; isolated tornadoes possible along the immediate Georgia coast on Wednesday.
